com.ikalagaming.database

Class DatabaseInterface

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ikalagaming.database.DatabaseInterface

  • public class DatabaseInterface
extends java.lang.Object
    Allows the program to connect with an SQL database.
    Author:
    Ches Burks

    • Constructor Detail

      • DatabaseInterface

        public DatabaseInterface(java.lang.String url,
                 int port,
                 java.lang.String username,
                 java.lang.String password,
                 java.lang.String database)
        Constructs a new DatabaseInterface with the given information.
        Parameters:
        url - the url to connect to (such as "localhost")
        port - the port number of the server (such as "3306")
        username - the username for this connection (such as "admin")
        password - the password for this connection (such as "password123")
        database - the name of the database to connect to

    • Method Detail

      • sendSafeQuery

        public java.sql.ResultSet sendSafeQuery(java.lang.String query,
                               java.lang.Object... arguments)
                                 throws InvalidQuery,
                                        java.sql.SQLException,
                                        java.sql.SQLTimeoutException
        Performs a safe database query using a PreparedStatement. The query should be a valid SQL query with question marks ("?") where the arguments should be inserted. String arguments should be supplied for each question mark. Returns a ResultSet that is returned by the query. Results is not guaranteed to be non-null. The results set should be closed as soon as possible to minimize the resources loaded.
        Parameters:
        query - the query to send to the database
        arguments - the arguments for the query
        Returns:
        the set that is returned
        Throws:
        InvalidQuery - if the query was badly formatted
        java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs; this method is called on a closed PreparedStatement or the SQL statement does not return a ResultSet object
        java.sql.SQLTimeoutException - if a database access error occurs; this method is called on a closed PreparedStatement or the SQL statement does not return a ResultSet object

      • establishConnection

        public boolean establishConnection()
        Connect to the database using the set properties.
        Returns:
        true if the connection succeeded

      • closeConnection

        public void closeConnection()
        Closes the connection.

      • isValidInput

        public static boolean isValidInput(java.lang.String input)
        Checks if the input is valid for sending to an SQL database.
        Parameters:
        input - the string to test
        Returns:
        true if it is valid, otherwise false
